elements.title: Chancellor Hut (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Chancellor Hut (pictured) is the oldest alpine hut still in its original location in the Southern Alps of New Zealand?

elements.title: Gembong Warsono (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Indonesian politician Gembong Warsono criticized the governor of Jakarta over municipally owned companies, sidewalk use, and imported dumpsters?

elements.title: Appellate Division Courthouse of New York State (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mohammed went from the roof of the Appellate Division Courthouse of New York State to a field in New Jersey?

elements.title: Michigan fake electors (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some of the Michigan fake electors attempted to enter the State Capitol, but were turned away by the state police?

elements.title: history of education in Wales (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that throughout the history of education in Wales, schools have been held in monastic settlements, cathedrals, residential houses, marketplaces, barns, churches, and village halls?

elements.title: modern Jewish historiography (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that dei Rossi's work on modern Jewish historiography was banned by Venetian rabbis, but he obtained imprimatur from a Catholic?

elements.title: Deli 613 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dublin restaurant Deli 613 imports frozen bagels from New York?

elements.title: Lady Six Monkey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lady Six Monkey was the only one of her four siblings not to be sacrificed?
